page.title: 07Communications.
page.content: Most households own a car; however there is a frequent daytime bus service to Trowbridge, Bath, Frome and Warminster. The nearest railway stations are at Westbury, Bath and Frome and trains take 90 minutes to London. Papers can be purchased in Southwick and are delivered in Rode for a small charge. Local papers, The Wiltshire Times and Somerset Standard appear weekly, but information on village matters is found in the parish magazines. Rode's monthly magazine, The Link, costing 15p, carries information about the churches, clubs, parish council meetings, births and deaths etc.. Villagers can send any non-political items for publication. The printing costs are partly met by advertisements by local tradesmen. There are public telephones in all the villages.
